articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Flood Watch is in effect for central Douglas County and surrounding areas from Monday evening through Wednesday evening. Heavy rain and rising snow levels may cause rapid runoff, leading to possible flooding of creeks, streams and low-lying areas. Residents should monitor forecasts.
articles.title: Flood Watch Issued For Douglas County And Surrounding Areas Through Wednesday Evening

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Winston Police K9 Nike will retire March 1 after more than eight years of service, including 110 deployments and 65 captures. The Belgian Malinois will live with his handler and serve as an ambassador for local K9 programs. A community retirement event is planned March 6 in Winston.
articles.title: Winston Police K9 Nike Set To Retire After More Than 8 Years Of Service

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Multiple traffic crashes were reported along with several warrant and parole-violation arrests, multiple DUII cases including a reported hit-and-run, a harassment/criminal mischief arrest, a trespass arrest and several prohibited-camping citations, according to the latest Roseburg police logs.
articles.title: Police Log: February 20 - February 23, 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Work resumes Feb. 23 on a Roseburg water main upgrade along SE Pine Street between Oak and Sykes. Crews will replace aging pipe, install hydrants and update service lines. One lane will be closed during weekday work hours, with construction expected to continue into early summer.
articles.title: Roseburg Water Main Project On SE Pine Street To Resume Feb. 23

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: UCAN’s Cheese & Thank You campaign returns this March, with local restaurants across Douglas County donating $2 from featured cheesy menu items to the UCAN Food Bank. A kickoff event with free grilled cheese is set for Feb. 28 in Roseburg to launch the month-long fundraiser.
articles.title: Cheese & Thank You Campaign Returns to Douglas County, Serving Up Comfort Food for a Cause

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: An autism awareness walk is planned March 1 at Fir Grove Park in Roseburg following the Fremont Middle School injury investigation. Organizers say the event aims to raise awareness and invite community participation after a grand jury declined to indict two aides.
articles.title: Autism Awareness Walk Planned in Roseburg Following Fremont Middle School Investigation

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Umpqua Valley Public Defender will debut its Equal Justice Initiative at a Roseburg art show featuring Jerome Sloan. The $5 entry event includes a silent auction and community dialogue. Proceeds will support rural public defense recruitment and training efforts across Oregon.
articles.title: Umpqua Valley Public Defender To Launch Equal Justice Initiative With Community Art Show In Roseburg

articles.author: Rachel McConaghie
articles.description: The criminal case involving injuries to two special needs students at Fremont Middle School, allegedly caused by instructional assistants, has been dropped, but parents remain concerned about transparency and are considering civil legal action against the Roseburg School District.
articles.title: Fremont Middle School in spotlight over student injury claims

articles.author: Eli Kuhn
articles.description: Jack Salberg, after overcoming a 29-year addiction with the help of Douglas County’s H.O.P.E. Drug Court and RSAT program, is now supporting others in recovery by raising funds for Oxford Housing residents.
articles.title: Roseburg man transforms life through drug court and helps others recover
